title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
cooking_instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook spaghetti until al dente.
In a pan, heat olive oil over medium heat, add garlic and pancetta. Cook until pancetta is crispy, then remove garlic.
In a bowl, whisk eggs with grated Pecorino Romano and Parmesan cheese, and a generous amount of black pepper.
Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water.
Add hot pasta to the pan with pancetta and remove from heat.
Quickly pour egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing vigorously to create a creamy sauce. Add reserved pasta water if needed to loosen sauce.
Serve immediately with extra grated cheese and black pepper on top.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into chunks
cooking_instructions: In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, turmeric, garam masala, and chili powder. Add chicken chunks, coat well, and marinate for at least 1 hour (or overnight in fridge).
Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger; cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add marinated chicken and cook until sealed on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Pour in tomato puree, stir well, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Stir in heavy cream and salt; simmer uncovered for another 5 minutes until sauce thickens.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rice or naan.
